definition: tugboat/boat towed by a tugboat/to tow a boat
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on

sentences.english: Early tugboats had steam engines; today diesel engines are used.
sentences.chinese: 早在拖船曾用蒸汽火車頭，今天柴油發動機使用。

sentences.english: You is invited to tender for construction of two tugboat.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎投標建造兩艘拖船。

sentences.english: While serving as a supply tug operator on Fondor, Shire also was a thief.
sentences.chinese: 希雷既是方多的補給拖船操作員，也是一個偷船賊。

sentences.english: Make fast two tugs on starboard quarter.
sentences.chinese: 把右舷後面兩艘拖船綁牢。

sentences.english: Horses used to tow barges along the canal.
sentences.chinese: 過去馬常常沿運河拖船。

sentences.english: A path along a canal or river used by animals towing boats.
sentences.chinese: 一條沿着運河或河流的，由動物來拖船拉縴的纖道。

sentences.english: Make fast tug(s) on starboard bow.
Tugboats are quite strong for their size.
sentences.chinese: 拖船是相當強勁，其規模大小。

sentences.english: The captain had to berth the ship without the aid of tugboats.
sentences.chinese: 船長被迫在沒有拖船幫忙的情況下泊船。

sentences.english: Harbor tugs are the most typical of the tugboats that people recognize.
sentences.chinese: 港口拖輪是最典型的拖船人們承認。

sentences.english: Make fast forward tug alongside on starboard.
sentences.chinese: 把停靠左舷的前拖船綁牢。

sentences.english: The smuggler shrugged to the bugler hugging the bug in the tugboat.
sentences.chinese: 私運者對在拖船中擁抱臭蟲的號手聳聳肩。

sentences.english: There are two groups of tugboats, either Inland or Oceangoing .
sentences.chinese: 有兩個團體的拖船，無論是內陸或遠航。

sentences.english: Special tugs now usher tankers in and out of Valdez to the open sea.
sentences.chinese: 現在，進出瓦爾迪茲港的油輪由特別的拖船引導。
